journal.title: Task Completed: Collect transcripts for critical CLI flows
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Collected transcripts for 9 critical CLI flows including help, find-specs, list-specs, progress, prepare-task, validate, query-tasks, list-blockers, and check-deps. Created comprehensive analysis document at analysis/cli-verbosity-transcripts.md with:
- Raw command outputs and character counts
- Verbosity assessments for each command
- Identification of well-optimized vs improvement-needed commands
- Statistical summary table
- Key findings and recommendations for verbosity tier definitions

Findings: Most commands already output clean JSON. Key targets for reduction: prepare-task (empty fields), validate (could be more concise), and ensuring --quiet/--verbose flags are consistently respected.

journal.title: Task Completed: Quantify message volume and frequency
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Quantified message volume and frequency through empirical measurement of 9 critical CLI commands. Created metrics document at analysis/cli-message-volume-metrics.md with actual measurements collected via wc and jq:

Real measurements:
- list-specs: 7,520 chars (30 specs, 10 fields each) - HIGHEST volume
- query-tasks: 5,761 chars (20 tasks, 8 fields each)  
- prepare-task: 1,027 chars (19 fields, 53% empty) - HIGHEST waste ratio
- check-deps: 88 chars (5 fields, 60% empty)
- validate: 305 chars (6 fields, 33% empty in schema)
- progress: 330 chars (10 fields, 0% empty) - OPTIMAL
- find-specs: 54 chars - OPTIMAL
- list-blockers: 3 chars - OPTIMAL
- --help: 8,390 chars - appropriate for help text

Key findings:
- Total measured output: 23,478 chars across 9 commands
- High-impact targets (57% of volume): list-specs + query-tasks
- Empty field waste: 615 chars (2.6% of total) across 3 commands
- Total reduction potential: ~7,519 chars (32% reduction)

Recommendations prioritized by impact for next tasks.

journal.title: Task Completed: Define verbosity levels and thresholds
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Defined three verbosity levels (QUIET, NORMAL, VERBOSE) with specific thresholds based on empirical measurement data. Created comprehensive policy document at analysis/verbosity-policy-definition.md including:

Verbosity Levels:
- QUIET: Minimal output, omit empty fields, 60-70% reduction for high-volume commands
- NORMAL: Current default behavior, no changes (backward compatible)
- VERBOSE: Enhanced debug output with _debug section, timing, and internal state

Thresholds defined:
- Character count targets by command category (minimal/low/medium/high)
- Field inclusion rules: omit null/empty in quiet, add debug in verbose
- Command-specific policies for 5 high-impact commands

Backward compatibility:
- Normal mode unchanged (zero breaking changes)
- Quiet mode opt-in via --quiet flag
- JSON structure preserved, exit codes unchanged

Implementation prioritized in 3 tiers based on impact from task-1-1-2 measurements.

Success criteria: 32% overall reduction in quiet mode, zero breaking changes, 100% command coverage.

journal.title: Task Completed: Document essential messages per level
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Documented essential messages and field mappings for each verbosity level across all 9 high-impact commands. Created comprehensive specification at analysis/essential-messages-per-level.md including:

Field classification system:
- ESSENTIAL: Always included (all levels)
- STANDARD: NORMAL and VERBOSE only
- OPTIONAL: VERBOSE only (_debug sections)
- EMPTY-CONDITIONAL: Omitted in QUIET when null/empty

Command-specific mappings for:
- list-specs: 4 essential fields (60% reduction in quiet)
- query-tasks: 5 essential fields (58% reduction)
- prepare-task: 3 core fields, omit 10 empty (53% reduction)
- progress: 5 essential fields (39% reduction)
- validate: Success = {"status":"valid"} (94% reduction)
- check-deps: 2 essential fields (49% reduction)
- find-specs, list-blockers: Already optimal

Detailed output examples provided for all three modes (QUIET, NORMAL, VERBOSE) for each command.

Implementation strategy:
- Dynamic field filtering based on verbosity level
- Schema-driven approach for maintainability
- Backward compatibility test matrix defined

Overall impact: 63% reduction across measured commands, estimated 62% reduction for typical workflow session.

Ready for phase 2 implementation (tasks 2-1, 2-2, 2-3).

3. src/claude_skills/claude_skills/common/sdd_config.py (MODIFIED)
